thread.title: Prep football: Fremd routs Palatine in crosstown battle - Chicago Tribune
thread.title_full: Prep football: Fremd routs Palatine in crosstown battle - Chicago Tribune

author: Bob Narang
title: Prep football: Fremd routs Palatine in crosstown battle - Chicago Tribune
text:
It's safe to say that Fremd senior running back Charlie Kaye owned the third quarter of Friday's crosstown battle with Palatine.
After rushing for 49 yards in the first half, Kaye carried the ball 15 times for 194 yards and scored three touchdowns in the third quarter to fuel the Vikings to a 49-19 Mid-Suburban West home win.
Kaye gashed the Pirates for a personal-best total of 250 yards and four touchdowns on 25 carries.
"The offensive line opened up huge holes for me, so big that you could've drove a truck through them," Kaye said.
With wide receiver Cordell Finley (right foot) and Michigan State recruit Kenney Lyke (left ankle) hampered by early injuries, Kaye handled the entire offensive load in the third quarter.
The Vikings (5-1, 1-1) didn't attempt a pass in the third, with quarterback Tom Josten handing the ball to Kaye on all 15 offensive plays. Kaye scored on runs of 4, 31 and 6 yards in the quarter, as the Vikings turned a 21-7 halftime advantage into a 35-14 lead. Kaye also had a 13-yard scoring run in the second quarter.
The 5-foot-6, 140-pound Kaye opened the third with a 38-yard run and added non-scoring runs 47 and 18 yards later in the quarter. The Vikings racked up 410 yards rushing and 106 passing.
Prep football: No. 19 Huntley hands Jacobs first loss Phil English Anthony Binetti, redemption is yours.
Shaking off what may have been his worst three quarters of high-school football, Huntley's senior quarterback led a 13-play, 65-yard scoring drive to put his team ahead by two scores.
Binetti capped the possession with a 6-yard keeper to help the No. 19 Red...
Anthony Binetti, redemption is yours.
Shaking off what may have been his worst three quarters of high-school football, Huntley's senior quarterback led a 13-play, 65-yard scoring drive to put his team ahead by two scores.
Binetti capped the possession with a 6-yard keeper to help the No. 19 Red...
(Phil English) "We had to have somebody step up," Kaye said.
The Vikings' defense struggled in last week's 26-17 loss against Conant last week but allowed only 67 rushing yards and forced five straight punts after the Pirates scored on their opening drive. Fremd's defense had two sacks and one interception to hold the Pirates (4-2, 1-1) to their lowest score of the season.
Bob Narang is a freelance reporter for the Chicago Tribune.
Player of the game: Charlie Kaye, Fremd, 25 carries, 250 yards, 4 TDs.
Key performers: Fremd — Kenney Lyke, 11 carries, 64 yards; Tom Josten, 9-for-14 passing, 106 yards. Palatine — Matt Lamm, 6 receptions, 117 yards; Michael Williams, INT.
